Name: Avernus
Description: The Canal emerges in the little lake called Avernus. A warm breeze ruffles blue waters. You and your crew shelter like vampires from the light, with awnings, curtains, broad-brimmed hats. Poplars, birdsong, the warmth of the Campanian sun.

DefaultEvent.Name: Green and gold
DefaultEvent.Description: The trees are the dusty green of old jade: the hills, tawny as a lion. You are pale as milk, all of you. The crew splash in the canal, whenever they can, to cool themselves after the heat of the sun. "It's not right up here," your bo'sun confides. "I keep thinking I'm going to fall off up, like. But it calms the heart to look at, don't it?" [The Surface is restful, but your crew may die here. The longer you spend up here, the more may die. This includes you.]

ChildBranches.Name: To Naples
ChildBranches.Description: The very last stretch of the Canal runs overland to the bay by Bacoli. Then it's an easy run down the Tyrrhenian coast into Naples.

DefaultEvent.Name: Silver-green safety
DefaultEvent.Description: Down into the dark and the quiet. No birdsong, no Surface wars, no raucous peasants. Still water, the glint of eyes.

ChildBranches.Name: Return Below
ChildBranches.Description: The sky is blue-hot metal. Cicadas buzz like a headache. This is no place for an honest zailor. [You will need ten Fuel and two Supplies to return below. If you have insufficient, you will be trapped here on the Surface.]

DefaultEvent.Name: A brief paradise
DefaultEvent.Description: You beach your steamer on the shores of Avernus. You and your crew are filled with the strange life of the Neath - the Sun will kill you, some day. How long? A day, a year? Ten years? Perhaps you'll farm in the shadow of the ship. Perhaps your children will point to its rusting shell and whisper, "That's where we came from. One day we'll go back."

ChildBranches.Name: End your journey
ChildBranches.Description: Ill luck or incaution has brought you to this. Your ship is stranded.

DefaultEvent.Name: Scorched by the sun
DefaultEvent.Description: Deserted or dead. Gone into the crowds. Slumped over the rail, your Neath-adapted life cindered by the true Sun. Drowned. Gone.

ChildBranches.Name: The ship is empty
ChildBranches.Description: Where are you, all of you?

DefaultEvent.Name: Snap it shut
DefaultEvent.Description: The box will remain filled with light until it's opened, even underground. They do it with mirrors.

ChildBranches.Name: Fill your Mirrorcatch Box
ChildBranches.Description: Open it wide. Let it bask in the light, until its baffles and convolutions brim with sun.
